body: Can you provide a demo?
@KonradHolubek What's the expected effect?
I got your point. Needs further discussion on this.

@MINDoSOFT Hi. I didn't quite understand this requirement. Why would you want *the data to appear, but the ticks to start rendering exactly on xAxis.min*? The viewer may get confused because they would expect the data on the left side to be with the minimum x value.
We are going to add border for legend items. Please follow #7340 .

ÊúÄÂ•Ω ÂèØ‰ª•Ëá™ÂÆö‰πâ È¢úËâ≤ Âõ†‰∏∫‰ªñÊó¢‰∏çÊòØÈò≥Á∫ø ‰πü‰∏çÂ±û‰∫é Èò¥Á∫ø ÊòØ‰∏ÄÁßçÂçïÁã¨ÁöÑÊåáÊ†áÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûú‰∏çËÉΩÂçïÁã¨ËÆæÁΩÆÈ¢úËâ≤ÁöÑËØùÔºåÊ≤°ÂäûÊ≥ïÂÅöÂå∫ÂàÜÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫ÂΩìÂºÄÁõò‰ª∑ÂíåÊî∂Áõò‰ª∑Áõ∏Â∑ÆÂæàÂ∞è(1ÂàÜÈí±)ÁöÑËØùÊ≤°ÂäûÊ≥ï Âà§Êñ≠ÊòØ‰∏çÊòØÂçÅÂ≠óÊòü

Basically I want to I achieve what is shown in this screenshot.

![EchartsXAxisFeature](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/890368/64018980-9a5d7780-cb36-11e9-8776-19e5bb63f422.png)

Data starts from Feb 2006 (or any month except January) but I want to render the next x axis tick on Jan 2007 because it makes more sense for someone looking at a chart where the x axis represents months, for the axis ticks/lines to appear when the year changes (e.g. January).

I hope that helps !

Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. üéâ
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

If you don't get helped for a long time (over a week) or have an urgent question to ask, you may also send an email to dev@echarts.apache.org .

If you are interested in the project, you may also subscribe our [mail list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html).

Have a nice day! üçµ
GitLab - https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/merge_requests/24945

Zoomdata 

It powers the majority of the charts in our analytics product with the exception of grids and maps (until we figure out how to make it play nicely with Leaflet¬†üòÄ). We've also been able to create our own extensions for chart types that are not offered out of the box (Like Packed Bubbles ) using D3's pack algorithm. ECharts offers all a ton of options out of the box to configure our charts and the necessary hooks to extend it when necessary with things like `echarts.registerLayout`. We are appreciative of all the work you've put in to make it the best charting library for big data üëç

Hello, any news on that one? That feature is really needed.
I suppose the problem is link styles do apply just once on node generation. I also had to 'restart' echarts component in React to change labels on case of language switching. Is there any chance for echarts to be more reactive? :)

You may need to add `legend: {data: ["C"], top: '17%'}` to `option2`. `echarts.connect` needs the same `legend[i].name` and `series[i].name`.

@yufeng04 - this is not fixing the issue - unfortunately. 

see here: https://jsfiddle.net/hm2L6gse/
Can you be more specific on what's expected? In your demo, which series are expected to connect?

Hi @lvca.  I think it's because your dataZoom will zoom all the x axes by setting
```
dataZoom:  {
   xAxis: [0, 1, 2, 3]
}
```

Which includes the x axis horizontal bar chart is using. You can try removing this axis from the array. For example if the index is 3, the `xAxis` value should be `[0,1,2]`

@pissang If I exclude the horizontal bar chart (xAxis=4], then when I zoom the candlestick area, it doesn't adjust the rendering with the zoomed values. With the candlestick, for example, I can zoom or even move the chart, then the chart scales to show different ranges of values because it tries to optimize the view for the displayed values.

Without the dataZoom, the horizontal bar chart remains static and doesn't follow the new scale. I tried also on playing with dataZoom and yAxis only for the bar chart, but the result is the same.

@Ovilia sure! 

**Current status:** 
1. After de-selecting first (A) of the items from the legend on chart1 
2. The charts are disconnected - The tooltip is displayed only on chart1 

**Expected:** 
1. After de-selecting first (A) of the items from the legend on chart1 
2. The charts are still connected - The tooltip is displayed on all of the charts 

Hope that clears it up a little!

We have implemented legend reverse selection in the latest code of master branch. It will be included in the 4.4.0 release. Which is planned to be release at the end of this month.
It's because the type of xAxis is `'time'`. You can try setting xAxis type to `category`

Hi @mdouaihy . Unfortunately there is no better solution. 

Or you can set  a smaller barWidth, but I guess it's not so flexible in you scenario.
Hi @eniaclyl . You need to use '$actoin: delete' to delete the elements. Check https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group.$action

If I understand well, what I'm asking is rather an enhancement and not a bug.

Do you think that echarts can automatically resize the bars to avoid the overlapping?
@mdouaihy Yes we will discuss about planning it in the version 4.5.0 https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/milestone/14
https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/issues/5429 Map with pattern also have a similar issue. Both are caused because map group has a very large scale value. I think they can be fixed together.
Ah great! looking forward to test it. Thank you for your efforts!

I removed puppeteer from devDependencies. It will download a binary executable file, which may cause install failed in China.
we have supported `roam` yet. You can configure this in `series.tree`.
Hi all, we have already supported this feature, you can configure `roam: true` in `series.tree`. So I will close this issue if you have any other question you can reopen this issue.

Agree with @100pah 

You can try ignore `useHoverLayer` flag when using SVG render and fallback to normal highlight approach, which will change the style of the original element.

It's more correct than return and do nothing . 

This solution also has  are some disadvantages, for example it will cause refresh and maybe block the user interaction when there are many elements. But I think developers should not use so much elements when using SVG renderer
@eniaclyl  It's not a bug. By default the option will be merged.
@pissang thank you
Still an issue on 4.2.1. Any plans to fix it?
Thanks @Ovilia , I fixed the coding style you mentioned

I tried to disable the line 180Ôºà`r0: 0`Ôºâ, and this time I can back to the root layout. But the presentation of 'ËôöÊûÑ' is not right.

Addition:
Why I can't find the configuration of `r`„ÄÅ`r0` and `position: 'outside'` in the document???

This is not quite a bug, but a bad design... When drilling down some levels that has `r0` as `0`, there is no place to put the return button. Not sure what can be done to fix this problem.
The `r`, `r0`, `position: 'outside'` is missing for the doc.
Surface needs grid data. I saw the y value in your data are all same. In this case, you should use line instead.

Source of WebGL texture needs to be canvas or image. So we need the container of echarts to be canvas.

That means the element you passed in `echarts.init` should be a HTMLCanvasElement

I think it's not a proper data for surface. Please use `line3D` instead. This is my try

![MacHi 2019-09-05 12-31-32](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/841551/64312094-2fe68480-cfd9-11e9-9ea4-4611b00a3183.png)

Thanks for the advice @zevero . We are planning to add automatic label layout to solve issues like this. Determine which labels can be visible in your case should also be included in this label layout strategy.

> Â∞Ü‰ª•ÈùûÊ¥≤‰∏∫‰∏≠ÂøÉÁöÑgeojsonÊîπÊàê‰ª•‰∫öÊ¥≤‰∏∫‰∏≠ÂøÉÁöÑgeojsonÔºåÊñπÊ≥ïÂ¶Ç‰∏ãÔºö
> 
> ```
> // ÂØπÁ∫¨Â∫¶ËøõË°åÂÅèÁßª
> const processLng = lng => {
>     return lng > -30 ? lng - 150 : lng + 210
> }
> 
> //ÂºïÂÖ•‰∏ñÁïåÂú∞Âõæ
> import worldMap from '../data/world.json'
> 
> const coordinatesList = []
> 
> // ÂØπ‰∏ñÁïåÂú∞ÂõæÁöÑjsonÊñá‰ª∂‰∏≠ÁöÑÁªèÁ∫¨Â∫¶ÂùêÊ†áËøõË°åÂ§ÑÁêÜ
> worldMap.features.map(district => {
>     if (district.geometry.type == 'Polygon') {
>       district.geometry.coordinates.map(border => {
>         border.map(coord => {
>           coord[0] = processLng(coord[0])
>           coordinatesList.push(coord)
>         })
>       })
>   } else {
>       district.geometry.coordinates.map(border => {
>         border.map(coordinates => {
>           coordinates.map(coord => {
>             coord[0] = processLng(coord[0])
>             coordinatesList.push(coord)
>           })
>         })
>       })
>     }
>   })
> ```
> 
> ËøôÊ†∑‰∏ñÁïåÂú∞ÂõæÁöÑÊïàÊûúÂèòÊàê‰∫ÜÊúüÊúõÁöÑÊïàÊûúÔºö
[](> ![world](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21993582/59204674-b3a7f500-8bd3-11e9-9f90-48a05e4d2a4d.jpg))
Ëá™Â∑±ÊåâÁÖßËøô‰∏™ÊñπÊ≥ïÂÆûÁé∞ÊòØËøô‰∏™ÊïàÊûú 
![3}CV_DP4T`USZC2CKLE5RA4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31274475/64312528-ed25ac00-cfda-11e9-8e4d-8e7ccf2c7afb.png)
You can't change the color of legend because it's connect to the series. You can use an image with specified color if really wan't to
Try [showMinLabel](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#xAxis.axisLabel.showMinLabel) and [showMaxLabel](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#xAxis.axisLabel.showMaxLabel)
